passages.text: Baxdrostat BaxHTN ES Presentation confirms clinically meaningful blood pressure reduction and

This weekend, we virtually attended the ESC 2025 Congress and Astra's ESC Meet Management event, where the detailed BaxHTN Phase III data was presented by Professor Brian Williams and reviewed by a discussant, Dr. Tomasz Guzik (headlines in July here). Baxdrostat showed a \(8.7\mathrm{mmHg}\) and \(9.8\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted reduction in systolic blood pressure at Week 12 in BaxHTN, which was met by a round of applause from the audience at the ESC Congress. The discussant also described baxdrostat's efficacy at Week 12 as "clinically meaningful" and also highlighted the durability of efficacy with the 2mg dose, which showed sustained blood pressure lowering through to Week 32.

Comparison of the data to Minerals Therapeutics' lourdrostat is best done at wk 6, where baxdrostat showed a placebo- adjusted systolic blood reduction of \(7.9 / 8.0\mathrm{mmHg}\) , which was only slightly lower than lourdrostat at \(9.0\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted reduction in the LaunchHTN trial. However, we believe this is likely due to the enrolment of a more challenging patient population in the BaxHTN trial, including lower enrolment of females, inclusion of more resistant hypertension patients and including patients with lower kidney function (eGFR) at baseline, which when taken into account suggests the products' efficacy is comparable. More importantly on 24 hour ambulatory SBP, exploratory efficacy in BaxHTN in c. 20 patients per arm showed a \(14.6\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted reduction for the \(1\mathrm{mg}\) dose and a \(16.9\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted reduction for the \(2\mathrm{mg}\) dose, which we see as encouraging for the Bax24 Phase III readout in 4Q 2025 (primary completion: Sep 2025) and as potentially differentiated from lourdrostat, which in the Phase IIb Advance HTN study showed a \(7.9\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted reduction in the \(50\mathrm{mg}\) dose arm. We also see differentiation from lourdrostat on the lack of drug- drug interactions, particularly with proton pump inhibitors.

On safety, discontinuations due to hyperkalemia were relatively low for baxdrostat at \(0.8\%\) and \(1.5\%\) for \(1\mathrm{mg / 2mg}\) and total hyperkalemia events were seen in \(2.7\%\) of patients in the \(1\mathrm{mg}\) arm and \(7.9\%\) in the \(2\mathrm{mg}\) arm, compared with lourdrostat's \(2.0\%\) in LaunchHTN. The discussant acknowledged that discontinuations due to hyperkalemia were rare for baxdrostat and that he expects lab monitoring to be indicated before and after treatment.

Asfra has guided for \(>55\mathrm{bp}\) peak sales for baxdrostat, of which at least half of which should be achievable in this uncontrolled/refractory hypertension indication alone. We model \(52\mathrm{bp}\) peak sales for baxdrostat, worth c. \(2\%\) to our NPV, and pre Q2 Company Consensus is for \(3.3\mathrm{bp}\) peak sales ( \(63\%\) PoS, \(\) 2.1\mathrm{bn}\(risk - adjusted), which, on the back of the detailed data, looks increasingly achievable in hypertension alone.
AZN.L, AZN LN Price (29 Aug 25):11,790p
European Pharmaceuticals & Biotechnology
Sophia Graeff Buhl Nielsen
Specialist Sales contact details:

See page 5 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures. J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

Overall, we see confirmation of a clinically meaningful \(9 - 10\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo- adjusted systolic blood pressure reduction at Week 12, with rare hyperkalemia- related discontinuations, as de- risking a competitive profile for baxdrostat in uncontrolled/ resistant hypertension and expect the shares to outperform by \(1 - 2\%\) today.

- Baxdrostat 1mg and 2mg showed a \(8.7\mathrm{mmHg}\) and \(9.8\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo-adjusted reduction in systolic blood pressure at Week 12, which looks competitive. Baxdrostat 1mg/2mg demonstrated a \(8.7\mathrm{mmHg}/9.8\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo-adjusted reduction in systolic blood pressure at Week 12. This compares with a \(11.6\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo-adjusted reduction for Minerals Therapeutics'lorundrostat at Week 12 in the LaunchHTN trial although we note this excludes patients from an arm of the trial who were allowed to dose escalate from \(50\mathrm{mg}\) to \(100\mathrm{mg}\) at Week 6 (i.e. less responsive patients). Efficacy for lorundrostat in this \(100\mathrm{mg}\) dose arm at Week 12 (50mg through to Week 6) was \(8.4\mathrm{mmHg}\) at Week 12. Pooled efficacy for lorundrostat across both doses was \(10.6\mathrm{mmHg}\) , which we see as a more relevant comparable for baxdrostat's efficacy in BaxHTN of \(8.7\mathrm{mmHg}/9.8\mathrm{mmHg}\) . At Week 6, which was the primary endpoint for lorundrostat \(50\mathrm{mg}\) , baxdrostat's placebo-adjusted reduction in blood pressure was \(7.9 / 8.0\mathrm{mmHg}\) , compared with \(9.0\mathrm{mmHg}\) for lorundrostat.

- A more challenging patient population likely impacted baxdrostat's efficacy in BaxHTN relative to lorundrostat. The BaxHTN trial enrolled more resistant hypertension patients than the LaunchHTN trial with around \(73\%\) of patients in BaxHTN having received at least 3 antihypertensives with \(61\%\) in the LaunchHTN trial. While baxdrostat efficacy in the subgroup analysis was slightly higher in resistant patients than in uncontrolled hypertension patients ( \(9.1\mathrm{mmHg}\) vs. \(7.3\mathrm{mmHg}\) ), we note the resistant population is more challenging to treat. Baseline eGFR was also slightly lower in the BaxHTN trial at c. \(85\mathrm{ml} / \mathrm{min} / 1.73\mathrm{m}^2\) vs. \(91\mathrm{ml} / \mathrm{min} / 1.73\mathrm{m}^2 \) in the LaunchHTN trial. Baxdrostat efficacy was lower in low eGFR patients with \(1\mathrm{mg}\) placebo-adjusted reduction of \(7.3\mathrm{mmHg}\) at Week 12 in \(60\) eGFR. The proportion of female patients enrolled was also lower in the BaxHTN trial at \(37\%\) relative to \(46\%\) for the LaunchHTN trial. Baxdrostat \(1\mathrm{mg}\) showed a \(9\mathrm{mmHg}\) placebo-adjusted systolic blood pressure reduction in females compared with an \(8.6\mathrm{mmHg}\) reduction in males. Overall, we see the differences in baseline characteristics as exemplified by the difference in placebo performance between BaxHTN and LaunchHTN with change in blood pressure at week 12 in the placebo group in BaxHTN at \(5.8\mathrm{mmHg}\) compared with \(7.3\mathrm{mmHg}\) in LaunchHTN.

- Ambulatory 24 hour systolic blood pressure exploratory data looks encouraging for Bax24 readout, expected by the end of the year, which could provide further differentiation. Efficacy on ambulatory 24 hour blood pressure was measured as an exploratory endpoint in 20 patients for the 1mg arm and 17 patients for the 2mg arm compared with 19 patients in the placebo group. This showed a 14.6mmHg placebo-adjusted reduction in blood pressure for baxdrostat 1mg, compared with a 16.9mmHg reduction for the 2mg arm, which we see as encouraging for the 24-hour systolic blood pressure trial for baxdrostat, Bax24, due to readout by the end of this year. This is superior to lorundrostat efficacy on 24-hour systolic blood pressure in the Phase IIb Advance- HTN trial which only delivered a 7.9mmHg placebo-adjusted reduction at Week 12. We note 285 patients were enrolled in the Advance HTN trial (comparable to actual enrolment in Bax24 of 217 patients), though the Advance HTN included 63% uncontrolled and 37% resistant hypertension patients compared with c. 73% resistant hypertension patients enrolled in BaxHTN. That said, we still see the 14.6mmHg and 16.9mmHg placebo-adjusted 24 hour ambulatory SBP efficacy as confirming the benefit of baxdrostat's longer half-life and encouraging for the upcoming Bax24 readout (primary completion: Sep 2025), which has the potential to provide differentiation vs. lorundrostat.
- Safety. On safety, serious adverse events in the BaxHTN trial were \(1.9\%\) in the 1mg

baxdrostat arm and 3.4% in the 2mg arm, compared with 2.7% in the placebo arm. This compares with 2.2% for the lourndrostat 5mg arm in LaunchHTN (0.4% placebo). Total adverse events were 47.3% and 44.7% in the baxdrostat 1mg and 2mg arms, marginally higher than the placebo arm (41.3%) and lower than the 53.8% seen with lourndrostat in LaunchHTN (placebo: 36.4%). On safety events of note, hyperkalemia was seen in 2.7% of patients in the 1mg arm and 7.9% in the 2mg arm which compares with 2.0% for lourndrostat in the LaunchHTN. That said, discontinuations due to hyperkalemia were only seen in 0.8% and 1.5% of patients in baxdrostat 1mg/2mg arm.

**·** **Discussant** **described** **efficacy** **as** **“clinically** **meaningful”,** **with** **ESC** **audience** **applauding** **the** **data.** The discussant, Dr. Tomasz Guzik (Editor-in Chief of Cardiovascular Research and Chairperson of Europe Society of Cardiology Research),described the efficacy of a 9-10mmHg placebo-adjusted reduction as “clinically meaningful" and we note the presentation of the data was met by a round of applause from the audience. The most interesting finding in Dr. Guzik's view is the durability of baxdrostat's efficacy where baxdrostat 2mg showed a sustained reduction in blood pressure out to Week 32. On safety, Dr. Guzik noted a “moderate dip" in kidney function and also highlighted that “discontinuations due to hyperkalemia were rare” and he expects monitoring of lab parameters to be indicated before and after treatment.

**·** **Commercial.** We include baxdrostat in our model at a $2bn peak sales opportunity at 100% probability, worth £1.96/1.7% to our NPV. Pre Q2 Company Consensus models $3.3bn peak sales potential, at 63% PoS. Astra has guided for $5bn+ peak sales for baxdrostat, with half of this in monotherapy in uncontrolled/resistant hypertension and the other half in combination with Farxiga in CKD and heart failure.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P.
